I have seen similar errors (bug 185166). Cleaning and recompiling all projects fixed it for me.

Good idea. I closed all but one project and cleaned that. On restart it asked me the initial mylar install questions, but otherwise remembered my config. But it's not exactly working.

Repeatably now, I can open eclipse fine, go to the Mylar tasks, and expand my query. Then, when I try to activate my current task, I get a crash.

JVM terminated. Exit code=1
/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.5.0-sun/bin/java
-Djava.library.path=/usr/lib/jni
-Dgnu.gcj.precompiled.db.path=/var/lib/gcj-4.1/classmap.db
-Dgnu.gcj.runtime.VMClassLoader.library_control=never
-Dosgi.locking=none

Is there any information in the log prior to the crash?  What Mylar build version is this?  Please consider trying it with today's Eclipse 3.3 dev build.

My Mylar versions appear to be: 2.0.0.v2007040.
I'm using Eclipse 3.2 and the 3.2 Mylar.
I don't yet have time to try the dev versions.

I still get crashes if I try to select a task. Otherwise, I can run eclipse OK, with the mylar plugin still there and the task window open.

When I try to select a task, I notice that before the crash, a dialog pops up for a second or two. The first time, it said, "Site https://cidgui.trac.iet.com failed to provide a valid response" or something like that. The second time it complained about a closed connection and something about SSL.

Can you go to your Task Repositories view and make sure that "Validate Settings" works for every task repository that you have?  Also, 2.0.0.v2007040 is not a version so it would be helpful if you could paste in the entire string of the version from the Help -> About Eclipse SDK dialog, then clicking the Mylar icon.

Both my "eclipse.org" and project repository validate. 
I can't paste the Mylar version string because I can't select it, but it is:
2.0.0.v20070403-1300.  Sorry I didn't see full string before.

Search for updates showed no updates.
Clicking on a project still crashes it (see below).

-Charles

JVM terminated. Exit code=1
/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.5.0-sun/bin/java

The VM should never crash and if it does there is a VM bug.  So the thing to try now are:
1) A newer or different VM to see if the behavior is the same.
2) Disable Mylar's use of the internal browser via Window -> Preferences -> Mylar -> Task List

Let me know if either of those work for you.

Disabling the internal browser allowed me to activate the task, though it showed no information on the task when opened. 

Right-clicking and selecting "open browser" crashed again.

Looking at the error message more closely, I see a lot of -Dgcj* stuff, while the jre is sun-java. Possibly a problem there. I'll look into switching my jre.

The problem is that your VM is crashing with Eclipse's internal browser.  This is not a Mylar specific problem, but we have troubleshooting steps here: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_User_Guide#Installing_on_Linux

Ok, thank you for spending time on it. It's clearly the internal browser.
This may be related to Bug 80033, since my trac site is https://.
Yes, there's a good chance that's it.  If that's the case, if you upgrade to Eclipse 3.3 it should work.
